headline: Bank Remains Bullish on BAC Despite Target Cut
summary: Canadian bank RBC cut its price target on Bank of America (BAC) stock to $45 from $50 but maintains a positive view of the shares. BAC reported its first-quarter financial results yesterday. Why RBC Cut Its Price Target on BAC But Remains Bullish RBC lowered its price target on BAC to $45 from $50 due […]

headline: Big banks report Q1 beats, China stops taking Boeing deliveries: Morning Buzz
summary: The major averages were fractionally higher near noon, adding slightly to yesterday’s gains as investors reacted to fresh headlines on U.S.-China trade tensions and a new round of corporate earnings. Markets are attempting to stabilize after a rocky stretch, but much of the tone is being shaped by President Trump’s latest tariff decisions. After last week’s escalation, he’s now backing off slightly, offering temporary relief on key consumer electronics and signaling possible concessions for the

headline: Big banks push for simpler mortgage rules as housing market slows
summary: Big banks are urging the Trump administration to simplify regulations on loan origination, servicing, and securitization. They hope these reforms could lower mortgage costs and boost lending activity.
